intro: Conostephium laeve, commonly known as the smooth conostephium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and oval, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer seasons. Conostephium laeve is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
